summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and defense attorneys from WilmerHale, representing JPMorgan Chase, regarding the criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails primarily concern scheduling meetings and calls to discuss identifying a trial witness from JPMorgan and issuing a subpoena for that witness.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale representing JPMorgan Chase, coordinating with prosecutors to schedule meetings and discuss trial witness issues for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, corresponding with defense counsel about scheduling, witness identification, and issuing a subpoena to JPMorgan.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale copied on the correspondence regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell trial and JPMorgan's involvement.

persons.name: Pat McHugh
persons.context: Individual referenced as needing to be included in a meeting between the prosecution and defense teams; appears to be associated with JPMorgan's response to the trial witness request.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case referenced throughout the email subject lines (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Mentioned in a salutation line alongside Alison and Lara, likely another member of the prosecution team.

persons.name: Lara
persons.context: Mentioned in a salutation line alongside Alison and Maurene, likely another member of the prosecution team.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney corresponding professionally to coordinate on trial logistics, specifically regarding a witness from JPMorgan.
Attorneys from the same law firm (WilmerHale) working together on representing JPMorgan's interests in the Maxwell case.
Defense attorney coordinating schedules to include Pat McHugh in meetings with prosecutors, indicating he is a representative of their client, JPMorgan.
Prosecutor copying defense attorney on correspondence related to trial witness issues.

events.title: Jury Selection in Maxwell Trial
events.description: Mentioned as making scheduling difficult for the prosecution team, indicating the trial phase was actively underway.

events.title: Subpoena Drafted for JPMorgan Witness
events.description: Prosecution attaches a broadly worded subpoena to JPMorgan to secure a trial witness, following a request from defense counsel.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting with Pat McHugh
events.description: Prosecution and defense teams plan a meeting for Monday at 6pm, potentially via Zoom, to discuss issues including the JPMorgan witness.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
7 World Trade Center, 250 Greenwich Street, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: JPMorgan Chase, represented by WilmerHale attorneys, was interacting with prosecutors to provide a witness for the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal trial.
The prosecution drafted and provided a subpoena to JPMorgan to secure a trial witness, indicating the bank held relevant information.
Email scheduling occurs during an active trial phase, with jury selection noted as a complicating factor for the prosecution's availability.
The correspondence shows professional coordination between adversarial legal teams on procedural and witness matters.
